channel.title: Please read this topic
channel.description:
hey uh im beginning java for the first time and i cant understand many tuts so can someone point me in the right direction to a good tut that could talk to someone w/an iq of 1. lol cuz i dont comprehend well. ty for any pointers too. and maybe if someone could point me to a good java editing program that would be nice.
ty,
Zetta

item.title: Please read this topic
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Look harder. VB.Net jobs are EVERYWHERE.

I agree I wouldn’t touch it though:P

Read full topic

item.title: Please read this topic
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:9, topic:288931”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=381963.msg2870747#msg2870747 date=1247753553]

Different language have different uses, maybe tell him why he should choose VB.net, Python or what next man would suggest him to learn.

Yeah but Visual Basic has no use.

Seen how much .net programmers are in demand atm?
[/quote]
I am a .net programmer (and getting paid for it), and I would never, ever, touch Visual Basic. C# is the only way to go for .net, imo.[/quote]
I second this, VB is shit. I never heard a .NET programmer getting hired to use Visual Basics.

Read full topic

ty,
Zetta

item.title: Please read this topic
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:

If you don’t comprehend well and can’t understand many times Java is not the programming language you’re looking for. It’s a sophisticated language, so I strongly suggest something like VB.net… if anything.
[/quote]
Please no, start with Python.[/quote]
Different language have different uses, maybe tell him why he should choose VB.net, Python or what next man would suggest him to learn.
